dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, November 11th is coming up, and you know what that means for shopping, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, November eleventh is coming up, and you know what that means for shopping, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, 11/11! Singles Day. That's, like, the biggest online shopping event in the *entire* world, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, eleven over eleven! Singles Day. That's, like, the biggest online shopping event in the entire world, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has become by far and away the largest shopping event in the world, raking in just over $30 billion in gross merchandise volume last yearand sales are expected to hit $37 billion by that same metric this year, according to Forrester Forecasts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It absolutely is. I mean, it's incredible. It only started back in 2010, really gaining prominence when, uh, Amazon really successfully launched its first shopping festival on that day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It absolutely is. I mean, it's incredible. It only started back in twenty ten, really gaining prominence when, uh, Amazon really successfully launched its first shopping festival on that day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Singles Day rose to prominence when Alibaba successfully launched its first shopping festival on that day in 2009;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's just exploded. I remember it started with, like, twenty brands, and now it's re-branded to 11/11, and we're talking about over 150,000 participating brands this year. That's just wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's just exploded. I remember it started with, like, twenty brands, and now it's re-branded to eleven over eleven, and we're talking about over one hundred fifty thousand participating brands this year. That's just wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: now re-branded as 11/11, the event boasts over 200,000 participating brandsup from 60,000 in 2017 and just 27 in 2009.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's absolutely wild. And the money! Last year, it pulled in just under $25 billion in gross merchandise volume, and they're expecting it to hit $35 billion this year. Uh, that's according to Forrester Forecasts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's absolutely wild. And the money! Last year, it pulled in just under twenty five billion dollars in gross merchandise volume, and they're expecting it to hit thirty five billion dollars this year. Uh, that's according to Forrester Forecasts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has become by far and away the largest shopping event in the world, raking in just over $30 billion in gross merchandise volume last yearand sales are expected to hit $37 billion by that same metric this year, according to Forrester Forecasts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And this year, it sounds like it's going to be even more international, which is interesting. Like, Amazon's actually decreasing some of the older items, but adding half a million *new* products.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And this year, it sounds like it's going to be even more international, which is interesting. Like, Amazon's actually decreasing some of the older items, but adding half a million new products.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The e-commerce festival is expected to be bigger and more international than ever in 2019, with Alibaba increasing the range of items on sale and adding 1 million new products on offer this year, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and get this, almost 35% of U.S. retailers are planning to get involved this time. We're talking big names, like Google, L'Oreal, they're all posting deals on Amazon's platforms, and their own U.S. sites.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and get this, almost thirty five percent of U S retailers are planning to get involved this time. We're talking big names, like Google, L'Oreal, they're all posting deals on Amazon's platforms, and their own U S sites.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A larger number of U.S. retailersalmost 25%, according to Adobe, plan to get involved, including big names ranging from Apple to Estee Lauder, posting deals on Alibabas platforms as well as their own U.S. websites.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And they really turn it into, like, a huge spectacle, too, don't they? With the fashion shows and concerts... I heard Justin Bieber is actually headlining the opening gala this year?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they really turn it into, like, a huge spectacle, too, don't they? With the fashion shows and concerts... I heard Justin Bieber is actually headlining the opening gala this year?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taylor Swift is set to perform as the headliner in the opening gala this year, while Kim Kardashian did a livestream on Tmall to launch her fragrances for the shopping festival.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] He is! And Kylie Jenner even did a livestream on Tmall to launch her fragrances for it. So it's not just discounts; it's a whole experience.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He is! And Kylie Jenner even did a livestream on Tmall to launch her fragrances for it. So it's not just discounts; it's a whole experience.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taylor Swift is set to perform as the headliner in the opening gala this year, while Kim Kardashian did a livestream on Tmall to launch her fragrances for the shopping festival.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's all about the experience now. Social media, video-driven e-commerce â€“ that's a huge part of it. Gamification, celebrity endorsements... it's really ramped up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's all about the experience now. Social media, video-driven e-commerce - that's a huge part of it. Gamification, celebrity endorsements... it's really ramped up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Experience is becoming widely seen as one of the keys to the festivals success, for example through celebrity endorsement and the gamification of the Alibaba platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And, um, interesting tangent here, it's actually the first year organizing 11/11 without the founder of one of the major companies behind it at the helm.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And, um, interesting tangent here, it's actually the first year organizing eleven over eleven without the founder of one of the major companies behind it at the helm.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 2019 will be Alibabas first year organizing 11/11 without founder Jack Ma at the helm, after Chinas richest man stepped down from his position as chairman in September.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. I mean, it's truly become, as Jiang Fan, the president of Alibaba's Taobao and Tmall, said, "the SuperBowl for brands."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. I mean, it's truly become, as Jiang Fan, the president of Alibaba's Taobao and Tmall, said, the SuperBowl for brands.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Crucial quote: Think of 11/11 as the SuperBowl for brands, Jiang Fan, president of Alibabas Taobao and Tmall businesses, told CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But there's a big question mark this year, though. A recent survey suggests that almost 70% of Chinese shoppers plan to boycott American goods during Singles Day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But there's a big question mark this year, though. A recent survey suggests that almost seventy percent of Chinese shoppers plan to boycott American goods during Singles Day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Almost 80% of Chinese shoppers said that they plan to boycott American goods during Singles Day, according to a recent survey from AlixPartners, which predicts the U.S.-China trade war taking a toll on participating U.S. brands this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, because of the U.S.-China trade war. That could really take a toll on those participating U.S. brands, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, because of the U S China trade war. That could really take a toll on those participating U S brands, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Almost 80% of Chinese shoppers said that they plan to boycott American goods during Singles Day, according to a recent survey from AlixPartners, which predicts the U.S.-China trade war taking a toll on participating U.S. brands this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's a huge wildcard for sure. So we'll definitely be watching how those numbers pan out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a huge wildcard for sure. So we'll definitely be watching how those numbers pan out.

dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's going to be fascinating.
